alert.note: Alert for Stark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 07 at 9:52AM EST until March 08 at 2:01PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cleveland OH has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Tuscarawas River At Massillon affecting Stark County. For the Tuscarawas River...including Massillon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tuscarawas River At Massillon. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding begins in the Agathon Park area to Route 21. Water encroaches on Route 62 in Navarre. Flood waters may force the closing of two railroad crossings in Massillon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Monday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 18.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 800 PM EST.
